DOC.brief_summary: The Effect of Robot Assisted Gait Training in Patients With Infratentorial Stroke
DOC.brief_title: Robot Assisted Gait Training in Patients With Infratentorial Stroke
DOC.detailed_description: The hypothesis is to determine the robotic gait training would be better than conventional therapy regarding the postural balance.
DOC.criteria: Patients with infratentorial stroke Cognitively intact enough to understand and follow the instructions from the investigator chronic neurological pathology orthopedic injuries femur lengths of less than 34cm severely limited range of lower extremity joint motion medical instability
